title: @RiotRepertoir Syndra is ''Fine''
body:
I'm really tired of ''stats don't matter''. It's very convenient to say that when the stats are bonkers.

**From OP.GG, data based on the Korean Server. **
''Syndra is fine. Mains are still doing fine with her''
{{champion:134}} : 46.67% Winrate 2.25% Playrate

''Only mains play Aurelion Sol, he's just in an ok spot''.
{{champion:136}} : 57.38% Winrate 2.07% Playrare.

Wow, basically the same playrate, yet more than 10% higher winrate. Syndra mains are suuuure doing fine.
-----------------------------
----------------------------
''Zed is in a bad spot. It's hard to win games as Zed. Buff buff.'' To be fair, he was in a meh spot multiple patches ago. But look at him now. 
{{champion:238}} : 53.12% Winrate 8.79% Playrate

Hmm, sure looks hard to win on Zed. He's said to have a higher skillcap than Syndra and brings no utility/hard CC to a team, yet much higher playrate and winrate.
---------------------------------------
--------------------------------------------
Azir was heavily nerfed do due his competitive prowess, which is true. He's also said to be harder to master than Syndra. Riot even said that they'll be keeping him in a pretty weak spot in solo q until they find a solution. Yet:
{{champion:268}} : 47.48% Winrate 7.33% Playrate

Even he is doing better than Syndra. The bias against Syndra is unreal. Just because people don't like playing against her ultimate.

----------------------------------
---------------------------------
----------------------------------

All we're asking is to revert the Q passive, which we never wanted and knew it would be bad for the champion. It's like the Riot balance team doesn't even play their champs. The most annoying part is that they saw Syndra mains speak out against the change, yet kept going without any response.

It would bring back the sphere management needed to access her burst (good change for enemies playing against Syndra) and would bring back the power her Q needs (good change for Syndra players).

It's a win win situation.

I just came out of a meeting where we talked about giving Syndra some help in 8.8, as well as a bunch of other things. However, we're adding some stuff to the patch that heavily influences her competition, so we'd like to see how those work out and then see if we think she still has room for some direct help after seeing how that goes.

Q passive could be the thing that we should do. To the best of my knowledge, I don't think anyone here is too particularly attached to that exact passive bonus.

What would be the scope you'd consider for Syndra changes? 8.8 is a big patch, and one of the running criticisms of Syndra has been that her passive feels lackluster in its implementation: would you consider changing the way her innate worked, or do you think it would be better to focus exclusively on a more targeted part of her kit?
Unsure. I imagine it would require some level of investigation. Her passive could be on the table; that doesn't seem unreasonable to me.
I suggest taking a look at Quest talents in Heroes of the Storm and trying something like that for Syndra. Require her to land hits with her abilities on enemy Champions to unlock rewards.

I second this. Syndra's innate has this amazing potential in what it represents, i.e. by having her empower herself by reaching mastery over the course of a match. However, the implementation is lackluster, because it mostly just boils down to a slight increase in stats at certain level milestones.

Seeing how League already has quest mechanics in place with support items, but also on Kayn, whose innate is its own kind of quest, it might help to look into a similar mechanic for Syndra, where using her abilities successfully (e.g. landing them against enemy champions) empowered them after reaching a milestone. Depending on the difficulty of these milestones, it could also allow for far more interesting and gameplay-changing effects than just bonus damage or range.

I think this could have some especially interesting implications for her ultimate. Since her ult's a multihit ability it would make sense for each hit to grant stacks meaning higher orb counts would stack up her ult more quickly.
I'm a little surprised that a new iteration of Cass's old passive didn't make a return on Syndra considering her theme of "infinite power".
Should give her more rewards for landing her abilities before she hits R to nuke me. It's always felt like if sydra is strong she can miss everything and still nuke you with the R
I dont care if you wanna buff syndra but i want some serious counterplay added to her ult first before you do anything
Reverting her Q passive would help a bit with that, since it would make it harder for Syndra to access her R's burst.

It would make it harder for the Syndra player but it wouldn't add counterplay to her R. It could be argued that it would add to the effectiveness of existing counterplay from ccing her or playing around her setting up, but that counterplay already exists and is honestly pretty useless for most people who don't also play Syndra a bit themselves. It would do little to nothing to alleviate frustration for her opponents.

As long as Syndra can miss all her skill shots and still flash + R + ignite and kill me from 90% hp the moment she hits level 6 just because I didn't take barrier I'm gonna hate playing against her.
The counterplay is avoiding Syndra when she has multiple balls on the ground, engaging on her when she has 1 rather than 2 or 3. It's time gated counterplay.

It doesn't take her long to cast more, she has multiple balls on the ground rather often after her first item, and giving a champion so much space that they can't flash to get within 675 range of you is not acceptable counterplay at level 6. And all of that doesn't even address the fact that the real range you have to avoid is actually her W which can hit someone 1175 away (range + radius) and apply the slow that sets up the easy stun which guarantees your death even from 100% hp.

So yeah, avoid being within flash + 1175 range of her a few seconds after she puts a ball on the ground cause otherwise you could die... Great counterplay. -_-

(and yes I know there are cast times, if your ms is low enough you can possibly flash to dodge, blah blah it's not that simple but honestly it's not far off and her R into E combos might be even more insane to deal with and still kill from a rather high % of hp vs most champs early on)

That's where the idea of removing the current Q passive comes in. 

Revert the Q passive, and even at 45% CDR the access to her seven ball ultimate drops down to about a 0.8second cast window. 
Whereas atm it sits much higher around 1.5 seconds. 

Without her orbs up as often with a different Q passive she doesn't have as much access to her orbs in general either. 

As far as point and clicks go it has counterplay in that you can block the damage via Zhonyas as a mage VERY easily. 
ADC's possess supports and often have positioning tools to avoid her when she has these orbs available.
Tanks don't care. 

It's time gated by her CD's and Orb Up time (Not as well as it has been in the past.). 
Take away her current Q passive and you have an ultimate skill that has reliable power, but plenty of levels of availability when it comes to playing around. (Because oddly enough Syndra being able to KILL her target sometimes is a good thing) 

There's really nothing else to add counterplay to the skill without outright removing it, and if there is I'm all ears. 

It's funny when people complain about Syndra's burst capability when hers is amongst the most gated in the entire game. 
Being the only one to require inside AND outside influences in the form of her orbs, being TIME gated AS WELL as CD gated. 

Ironic when other burst mages like {{champion:45}} {{champion:103}} {{champion:99}} {{champion:1}}  who just hit their signature CC and blast you off the face of the planet, Syndra isn't going to be doing that without SOME form of set-up before hand.

I have some tips that I'll post again in this thread:
1) Don't approach her when there are spheres on the ground.  If she has at least 2, she can combo you without you being able to do much. Be mindful of her positioning, and that of her spheres.  If there is a sphere in between the two of you she will stun you and combo you down.
2) A lot of Syndras will use their stun to engage and win trades early.  She will run out of mana very quickly doing this.  When you see the delay for the sphere, sidestep.  Take advantage of the long CD and punish her if she gets too close. 
3) Take barrier, and make sure to buy MR early to negate her burst.

While not quite, it takes her landing VERY little so long as she has a few spheres.  And you can't exactly play around them all the time.  So long as one is on the ground, she can cast Q again for a second, and have a 5 sphere ulti.  That+Q damage is enough to really chunk most champs who are not building hard durability, add in an E that will nearly guaranteed land after all those spheres hit the ground around the target, and yea.  You can't really dodge that.

The Q duration upgrade probably is tied to the wrong ability if they do want extended sphere up-time to be a thing.  Tying it to her first max means she is expected to have it very early on, and all the time after that.  Her main DPS spell becoming the setup for her biggest burst spell.

Instead, tie it to her W max, and put the true damage component back onto the Q.   If you want to massively increase your sphere count, you gotta max W after Q, but that comes at the trade of the CD of your stun, which is also a major pick tool and potential AoE stun for teamfights, which generally means you won't until the very end, unless you are really desperate for the increased access to your single target burst and skirmishing power at the cost of your biggest AoE and teamfight tool, which, IMO, is very fair.
They need to shift power away from her R or rework it completely to properly balance Syndra. I agree that she's way too weak right now though. As a Viktor/Azir player I know that feeling.

Thank you for addressing this here. I remember when a Rioter said that it's fine if Syndra is just a "counterpick" (with a 2% playrate btw) and nothing else, which pisses me off to no end when the majority of mid lane champs are better than her in every way imaginable.  Although I actually like the current Q passive, if they have to revert that to put more power into her kit, then I'm down for it.

She needs a rework, not just one of those mini reworks they do in the class updates, but a straightup rework. I feel like Riot missed the mark thematically and gameplay-wise with Syndra. Her kit just doesn't mesh well together imo.
She needs a new passive and a more interactive ult. Also remove all her bugs.
